data.title: Awards – New York Film Critics Circle
data.text:
Jump to: NYFCC Student Critic Prizes

2023 Winners

Best Film:

Killers of the Flower Moon

Best Director:

Christopher Nolan, Oppenheimer

Best Actor:

Franz Rogowski, Passages

Best Actress:

Lily Gladstone, Killers of the Flower Moon

Best Supporting Actor:

Charles Melton, May December

Best Supporting Actress:

Da’Vine Joy Randolph, The Holdovers

Best Screenplay:

Samy Burch, May December

Best Animated Film:

The Boy and the Heron

Best Cinematography:

Hoyte Van Hoytema, Oppenheimer

Best Non-Fiction Film:

Menus-Plaisirs – Les Troisgros

Best International Film:

Anatomy of a Fall

Best First Film:

Past Lives

Special Award:

Karen Cooper for her five decades of creative leadership as director of Film Forum.

Search the Database

This list contains all past award winners going back to 1936. Use the search filters at the top or bottom of the list to find specific names, years, or films. Or, select “show all entries” and scroll through!

NYFCC Student Prizes

As a way of supporting and encouraging the next generation of writers, the New York Film Critics Circle gives prizes to two student critics every year. Winners receive a cash prize, an award certificate, and two tickets to the Circle’s annual gala, which is typically held in the first week of January.

Currently, there are two prizes of $2,500 each: One will go to an undergraduate student, the other to a graduate student. Applicants should be attending college in New York State and be studying or have an interest in film criticism/journalism.

Applicants should submit two reviews/essays of 500-800 words each. One piece should be on a recent film from the current calendar year. The other should be on an older film from before 1980.

The contest officially opens after Labor Day of the current year. Deadline for all submissions is November 17. Winners will be announced after the NYFCC voting meeting in early December.

All questions and submissions should be directed to NYFCC member Keith Uhlich at keithuhlich@gmail.com.
